column4: Hi guys.  I'm trying to compile a gwenview extension (external tool) that is called gwenrename.  I need to compile it.  When I run configure all is ok until it comes up with this message: "configure: error: Can't find X includes..." .  I know Ubuntu uses x.org instead of XFree86.org.  I need to know the path to x.org "includes" and "librairies".  I' m running a fresh install of Ubuntu Hoary upgraded with all available stable pack
ages.  Can anybody assist. Thx.
apt-get build-depends <some gnome tool>
apt-get build depends gwenview
you wrote: " apt-get build depends gwenview". that will do what? Install sources?
guess I should have listened earlier... I'm like that sometimes  :o|
k I'll do
... by the way configure is asking for zilb, which is installed (zlib1g) do you think it's a good thing to install thde dev package too?
yes
k doing so..
on my machine "sudo apt-get build-dep gwenview" gets all the dependencies
I was misspelling it earlier ;)
ok that's it I'm going for your  "sudo apt-get build-dep gwenview" command, configure keeps asking me for new dependdencies . lol

mouhahaha! 59 packages to install... would have been long 1 at the time! thx guess this will do the job.  Gwenrename is basically a batch renaming scheme for gwenview.  You know what: the more I use Ubuntu (well Kubuntu) the more I love it.  Finaly I can run real apps that won't Winblow!
yeah, I tested the command and replied "N" to downloading the complete KDE developer stuff
tried gnome (Ubuntu) and liked it too. But am more the K style :o)

what I love the most is that I've been trying for a very long time to run a http server (undern Windows) but it just wouldn't work with all I needed... Unless paying ($) alot. Now: wow! I just installed a Mambo php routine on my server and I am having the fun of my life.
and I just can't believe how fast gcc compiles an app on my PIII   :o)
My sources are all there. configure went trough the whole routine. I can make, make install. Many thx :o)
best of british
fast learning french canadian
it's an expression..."best of british luck to you"
oh... still having to learn french canadian then . lol
